revised_title: Extra-Uterine Pregnancy: A Medical Case Study
tldr: This article presents a case study of a woman who had an extra-uterine pregnancy, where the fetus was outside the womb but still connected to the mother's body. The author, Robert Houstoun, describes the medical examination, treatment, and the eventual outcome when the mother passed away. The case highlights the challenges in providing medical care for such rare conditions and the importance of understanding the anatomy and physiology of pregnancy.
scientific_discipline: Medicine and Health Sciences > Obstetrics and Gynecology
